content: hello crafters and welcome to the dams craft I am Scotty good to have you with
me today we're going to do a terrain feature that is a slime pool and it's
very similar to the water type effects that I've done but it's I'm gonna have
some bubbles some bubbling on the pool which is kind of interesting and I'm
also going to add another feature so kind of broken up floor pieces that are
actually in slime pool so this is so it's kind of a modification of the water
technique but let's go the table I'll show you how I'm going to do that here's
a tile from AJ's dungeon I've done it in the ONC's black or the basalt black
texture paint and what we what's he wanted to have was like this kind of a
slime pool that was a cross that stoop and the room but I thought it might be
interesting to add a little extra element to that and what I've done is
I've taken a thin piece of cardboard and you can see it's very thin and I've
sprayed it with the black texture paint and then what I did is I just cut it up
so here's the pieces that I've cut up and you can see I just cut up some
random pieces so I'm going to apply these to the tile and then you'll see
how I'm going to work this into the slime pool so what I'll do is I'll grab
my tile and then I've got my trusty glue gun and I'll just start applying these
pieces so they kind of blend in there so what
I'll do is I will finish applying these pieces and then I'll give you a look at
it so these pieces are kind of hard to see pulled up a little bit maybe you can
see a little better there so you can see this pieces there now what I'll do when
I finish this is I will rim them with this kind of blueish gray so it gives
them a little more definition but they'll really pop out once I get to
slime pool on so I'm going to use my large glue gun and then I'm gonna start
giving the slime pool some definition and just kind of work your way around
I just kind of rim those pieces and remember when you do this kind of glue
gun stuff as other people have noted you might get some little wispies which are
just the glue gun strands and just pull those off just just just knock those off
if you need to you can usually rub them off and it's pretty easy to take care of
those but see that's given some interest there with just a some texture going
around those pieces that's all there is to it with some of the open areas I want
to do a little interesting technique where I do kind of like a bubble wing so
what I'll do is I'll kind of do a flop in the center and where I want it and
then kind of pull it out as like a circular motion and then put a blop in
the center a blob in the center and that'll look like a kind of bubble
that's coming up from the slime and so you can add you can add more of those so
just do a circular pattern like that let the glue gun when you get done have a
blop in the center and you can make different sizes and that kind of thing
so if you find your blop is cutting going down too much you can always after
it dries you can always add another another one now I make this smaller one
here so yeah if your block kind of blends in
too much wait for it to dry and then just add a little bit more add another
blop in the center and it'll it'll kind of highlight it so now what I'm going to
do is I'm going to I'm going to texture the rest of this going around these
bubbles and then I'll add one more detail and we'll talk about that okay
I've got it finished and I got on my little oops on there and it's all filled
in now you'll notice that when I fill it in I don't totally feel it it looks
quite filled in more so than I interview with water because I'm getting trying to
get a rougher texture but I usually don't fill it in this much for water and
even this isn't all the way filled in so you don't have to fill everything every
single little inch of this in some Board can show through because you just paint
through it now what I want to do them to flip it so it'll be a little easier for
me to work with and I wanted to kind of have the nature of this crypt I wanted
to kind of have some almost like tendrils coming off of the slime itself
so what I'll do is I will start doing that and I'm just gonna free freewheel
this I'm not going to draw or anything like that so I can kind of pull it and
if you pull it you'll give it some kind of weird texture II it'll look it'll fit
in with the rest of the slime so it's almost like tendrils of slime
coming off this all right so there we go it's kind of
hard to see like I say without the paint on it but once we paint it up it'll look
really great so I'll go ahead and we'll start painting this up and that'll be
our next segment so guys I've already got my blue gray on my palette and I'm
gonna start picking out some of these chunks that I've got that are kind of
floating her and you know alright that that's morass of goo is moving around so
I've got a small chisel edge brush and I'm just gonna kind of go around the
edges now I'm getting some on the slime but that doesn't really matter because
I'm gonna repaint I'm gonna repaint the slime so that's why I'm doing these
first I don't have to be that careful about getting on the edge of these
pieces that way it'll make it easier when I do the slime so kind of nice to
think about when you're doing projects to think about the order of the projects
because sometimes an order can make it harder or easier to do sometimes you
really don't have much choice about the order but like times like this you do so
you know take advantage of it and you can get all you can get as messy as you
want so now I'm let me give you a little close-up there so now I'm going to paint
the rest of these pieces and then we'll come back and we'll start painting the
slime pool for the slime pool itself I'm going to use a hunter green so I'm gonna
grab my fairly big brush but it's still like a chisel brush and I'll just start
applying that if you feel that you need to get into
some of the spaces that it's too the brush is too wide you can always
switch to a smaller brush and some of these tendrils I'm going to do that too
so I'm just going to kind of not try to get the whole thing I'm just going to
get a general coverage so what I'm gonna do is while I'm going to do a little bit
more of this with a thinner brush while this is wet that way I can add some of
the other colors because I you get a nice blend if it's still wet and it
doesn't take long for acrylic paint to dry up so if you put it on a little wet
it'll stay a little longer just add a touch of water
okay now I'm gonna start adding some other colors to this I have a spring

will be kind of a mid so I'll just kind of grab that this is a spring green and
see it's kind of blended in with here's a bubble I did so you're getting kind of

I'm putting quite a bit of the other paint on the brush so I can get that

now I want to add a little bit make it a little more radioactive green so I'm

a bit never really looked looking like a toxic
miasma slime like I say a light hand is better than a heavy hand on this you can
always add more all right that is looking suitably gross so now we'll do
the I'll do the other half and then we'll let that dry and move on to the
next step so my slime pool is dried but now for
the final touch you know we want to add we want to make it very glossy so I'm
gonna use my this is a separate jar that I've put some water-based gloss in and
you just get this at the hardware store or any almost any big-box store really
it's just all it is is just gloss that you can put on furniture and that kind
of thing and it's just water-based so the cool thing about that is you can
wash your brushes off with water so you don't ruin your brushes so what we'll do
is we'll fill this in with the water base gloss and usually usually it takes
about two coats to get something super glossy that's about what I use on water
and that kind of thing so we'll put we'll put a couple coats on here and
then we'll come back and look at this with a figure
here we go here's our finished room and we have a miniature on there for scale
so you can see the poor little guy here and I love this kind of stuff because
it's like the players don't know what to make of it it's like is this just a
barrier that they have to get by it's obviously something not natural so is it
just some kind of obstacle they have to get by or is it actually something
living or is it is there something hiding in it or how deep is it is it
magical you know there's all these questions that can arise and it seems
you know fairly easy you know that the player could hop these you know areas
and get over here but you know hey it may not be that easy you know the they
may sink or they may tip you know and slide in or they they can be floating
and not solid on the surface so you know depending on how you want to play it
these things can be really interesting but what I'm going to do here real quick

describe to the players as it's kind of amorphous like it seems to move a bit it
doesn't seem to be totally defined the edges move a bit so I love these kind of
obstacles and really looks creepy and icky and slimy which is what's the whole
